revised_title: Investigating the Initial Stages of Spark Discharge and its Emitted Light
tldr: The authors conducted experiments using submicrosecond impulses to study the initial stages of a spark discharge and the light emitted from it. They measured the threshold voltage at which the first visible discharge occurs in a homogeneous field electrode gap, using various gases at different values of gap and gas pressure. The study included spectroscopic analysis and high-speed photography to reveal the characteristics of the discharges and the transition from an electron avalanche to a streamer or glow discharge.
